item.title: Even more gang grafitti on the shop front, 6th September
item.description:
This could be related to gang activity, we feel unsafe living on a building covered in gang graffiti, there are many families living here that coil be at risk. I see there was another ticket open for the grafitti, but in that one there was less, and still nobody did anything

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 365, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Dangerous bend - request for convex mirror, 6th September
item.description:
The bend on Berryhill (around numbers 28-42) is almost completely blind. The cars coming from either side of Berryhill are not able to see the cars coming from the other direction. Also, as this is a narrow residential street, cars are parked on the side of the road, blocking the view further. This issue could resolved by a convex mirror installed on a pavement. Drivers are not always aware about the view issues and drive too fast on this stretch of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Berryhill, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gas tanks let in the road, 6th September
item.description:
There are gas tanks left on the street, blocking multiple parking spaces. I don’t see any parking suspension notices.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sewdley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MEGA DUMP ALERT: Hotel Mattresses, Rubbish & Sink, 6th September
item.description:
DUMP ALERT! Yes indeed, another spectacular DUMP at the end of St George's Drive opposite iconic Thomas Cubitt statue. The dump had not yet occurred at 9:30pm last night (5-Sep-25), so it would have been a sneaky overnight mission. When is Westminster Council finally going to get its act together, catch and fine the dumpsters, and STOP THE DUMPS? Mattresses are marked as 'Hotel Contract Beds' along commercial waste red bags and sink next to mattresses, which could indicate a hotel as culprit, although this is only a hypothesis #Howquicklydoyouwantoturnpimlicointoaslum?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121A, St George's Drive, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet
